If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind feature
> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
> /kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
Evaluating e2e tests based on available [PodSpecs](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/core/types.go#L2473) options which are covering important aspects with user scenarios and **_eligible to promote for conformance_**.

**What you expected to happen**:
These 4 e2e tests evaluate different [PodPhase](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/core/types.go#L2068) and [PodStatus](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/core/types.go#L2715) based on [InitContainerStatuses](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/core/types.go#L2750).

1. InitContainer [NodeConformance] should invoke init containers on a RestartNever pod
> - Looks for **PodPhase=Succeed** (all pods terminated with exit status 0)
> - Pod is initialized (means all init container started)

2. InitContainer [NodeConformance] should invoke init containers on a RestartAlways pod
> - Looks for **PodPhase=Running** (atleast 1 container is running)
> - Pod is initialized

3. InitContainer [NodeConformance] should not start app containers if init containers fail on a RestartAlways pod
> - Looks for **PodPhase=Pending**
> - Restarted Pod atleast 2 times

4. InitContainer [NodeConformance] should not start app containers and fail the pod if init containers fail on a RestartNever pod
> - Looks for **PodPhase=Failed**
> - One of container status is waiting

**Anything else we need to know?**:
1. Please comment, **_Are these tests good to promote for conformance_** or do we need to look on other aspects as well ?
2. Below are observed api endpoint hits during tests execution. (API coverage improvement) -
